article.headline: Stocks open higher after Trump says he's open to stand-alone stimulus measures
article.body: Stocks rose at the start of Wednesday's trade after President Donald Trump said Tuesday night he was open to a number of independent fiscal stimulus measures, changing course after previously calling for an end to negotiations on a coronavirus aid relief package. The S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% rose 1.2% to 3,401. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% advanced 315 points, or 1.1%, to 28,088. The Nasdaq Composite COMP, +1.39% climbed 1.3% to 11,296. Airline stocks were trading higher, with the U.S. Global Jets ETF JETS, +0.16% up 2.3% after Trump's call for aid to airline workers.
